availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis S. Cole (Knox County, KY, soldier )

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Lewis and Polly Lewis. Resident of Knox County in 1850. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A) as a private from October 1862 to March 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 388A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lee County, Coal Branch Precinct, p. 322A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0129.
